name: You Can Never Escape
description: A solution may be on the horizon, one that can address the cause of this strange phenomena. However, there are too many who would benefit from things staying as they are and they are ready to put up the fight of their lives.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In a Voyage Event, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each contest: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance for the contest.
-- Using Henoch Spock, any version of Seven, Howard, O'Brien, or Compromised crew will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points.
-- Using the Borg Tactical Cube, Harrad-Sar's Barge, the Borg Sphere, or ships with the Borg trait will provide a bonus to antimatter.
-- Earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Borg (Ship trait), Henoch Spock, Seven, Howard, O'Brien, or Compromised

featured_crew.name: Toreth
featured_crew.flavor: Toreth’s long-standing distrust of the Tal Shiar raises the stakes on an intense mission to smuggle defectors to the Federation without her knowledge.

featured_crew.name: Felisa
featured_crew.flavor: During her lifetime, Felisa had a lover, Ronin, who was an anaphasic creature and who possessed her exhumed corpse.

featured_crew.name: O'Brien
featured_crew.flavor: O’Brien was replaced with a clone to derail the peace talks. However, the clone, for some unknown reason at first, tried to save the day.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Torres
rewards.flavor: Torres, under the control of Teero Anaydis, helped lead a Maquis revolt on the U.S.S. Voyager.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: B. Shuttle
rewards.flavor: 10 Basic Boosts. Go to Time Portal to collect!

ship.name: Borg Sphere
ship.flavor: Borg spheres were primarily scout and long-range tactical vessels. Borg cubes sometimes housed Borg spheres as auxillary craft.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Toreth
rewards.flavor: Toreth’s long-standing distrust of the Tal Shiar raises the stakes on an intense mission to smuggle defectors to the Federation without her knowledge.

rewards.name: O'Brien
rewards.flavor: O’Brien was replaced with a clone to derail the peace talks. However, the clone, for some unknown reason at first, tried to save the day.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine
